comments: i had slight to moderate acne that wa just really annoying and wa not fixed by any type of treatment so i filly gave in and went on accutane after reading all the online horror story i wa scared out of my mind however i had a great experience on it i took 80mg day for 5 month and weigh 200 lb 90 kg so it wa about 1 mg day kg which is a moderate to high dose i wa told my lip were pretty dry and cracked if i did not put on chapstick all the time i also had really dry skin if i did not put lotion on my shoulder arm back and face after showering everything else wa 100 fine though no nosebleed no depression no hair loss no unbearable side effect these horror story are overblown and rare and ton of people have great result on it my acne is gone 100 from all over my body and it is such a relief to not have to deal with it on completion my dermatologist told me he ha prescribed it for 10 year and ha never once had a case of depression and only 2 people have had bad blood test if you are tired of acne give accutane a shot if the side are too rough in your case then you can go off of it but it is such a great drug if it work for you the way it did for me and many others like me

comments: i am only 15 and wanted to not have to fight acne for the rest of my teen year i have tried multiple amount of acne medication but were all ineffective and i suffered more than i did on accutane yes the side effect were odious but it wa nothing that i could not handle the worst wa probably the dry lip in which i soon discovered that the classic cherry chapstick wa sent from heaven and must be applied consistantly i got a lot of bad sunburn rash and my face wa constantly red and peeling i had to get a quality moisturizer and apply throughout the day and even that wa not efficient i eventually had back pain and wore out easily red eye nosebleed and minor depression in addition ipledge and the monthly blood test are a hassle but from the first week i started to clear up continually without initial breakout until now i am 100 acne free i used to have very oily skin and hair which now i do not have to worry about i know result differ from each individual but i wanted to spread the word that it can work and i have a lot of friend that have benefited from this product also acne is not the end accutane can really boost your self confidence i would recommend on giving it a try it could change your life forever

comments: this medication and other benzodiazepine ha gotten a bad reputation because some irresponsible people have ruined it for those that actually need it if people would take this drug a prescribed there would not be a many problem and it would not carry the stigma it doe now i started having panic attack when i turned 21 and the condition soon worsened into full blown panic disorder a year later i could not hold down a job and wa agoraphobic i tried counseling and medication like zoloft and lexapro the side effect from those made me feel worse than i did just not taking them filly my doctor decided to put me on alprazolam a needed it ha been a life saver for me i would take the lowest dose 0 25 mg and be able to leave my house for the first time in month i visited friend went to restaurant and did everything i used to do before my disorder i filly felt like i had my life back i would take one whenever i anticipated a situation where i could have an attack or when i felt one coming on already sometimes i did not even need all of the 0 25 mg and could break it in half too many people abuse this medication by upping their dosage without a doctor s consent or using it when they do not need to and now you are almost treated like a crimil at some pharmacy and doctor s office when they learn you are taking it because they think you are a druggie i much prefer this medication over any of the ssri which have horrible side effect i felt like a zombie on those medication had no sex drive at all and did not have any energy whatsoever the doctor tell you those side effect will go away with use but for day to even week you feel 10 time worse than you did before it is just not worth it 0 25 mg of alprazolam a needed for anxiety ha helped me get my life back on track and really helped save me from spending day and night locked away in my house i highly recommend this medication for responsible people who just need something in a crutch and do not want to go on long term ssri that leave you feeling drained and lifeless yes counseling and therapy are a better altertive to medication but the problem is always finding a good counselor and sometimes even then they just do not work i have seen 3 counselor and all of them have failed to help me with anything all i did wa waste a 20 copay each visit to have them tell me thing that sounded like they came from an inspiratiol booklet taken a prescribed or a needed this drug is wonderful

comments: many people i know i now work a a health care professiol erroneously believe that valium xax ativan and other benzodiazepine must be used a directed and have enhanced benefit if built up in the brain ie in way similar to ssri s effect on the brain over time i wa entirely aware that diazepam is a prn medication and chose to use the prescribed dosage on one particular day hoping it would carry me through a difficult situation unfortutely i suffered a paradoxical reaction which cost me dearly in many tragic way i wa in a state of severe psychosis for day because my benzo level wa low when admitted to the hospital i wa given diazepam for an additiol two day whereupon i apparently refused to take any medication at all and recovered a i detoxed i have absolutely no memory of five day of my life i have done research into this phenomenon and must warn all that this seems to occur most often in indiviguals with dopamine gaba reuptake variant such a those with adhd parkinson and also ptsd diazepam is a bandaid and offer no long term therapeutic benefit whatsoever in fact rebound anxiety and profound depression are common what is most ironic is that in the medical setting this occurs often after administration of versed is recognized quickly and fluzanimine is given a an antidote outside of this scerio the patient is blamed treated a a suspected drug addict and stigmatized

dosage: 75 mg,37 mg  taken daily for the period of 1 year
benefits: venlafaxine is a bicyclic antidepressant and is usually categorized a a serotonin norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor snri but it ha been referred to a a serotonin norepinephrine dopamine reuptake inhibitor it work by blocking the transporter reuptake protein for key neurotransmitter affecting mood thereby leaving more active neurotransmitter in the sypse the neurotransmitter affected are serotonin 5 hydroxytryptamine and norepinephrine noradreline additiolly in high dos it weakly inhibits the reuptake of dopamine with recent evidence showing that the norepinephrine transporter also transport some dopamine a well implying that snris may also increase dopamine transmission this is because snris work by inhibiting reuptake i e preventing the serotonin and norepinephrine transporter from taking their respective neurotransmitter back to their storage vesicle for later use if the norepinephrine transporter normally recycles some dopamine too then snris will also enhance dopaminergic transmission therefore the antidepressant effect associated with increasing norepinephrine level may also be partly or largely due to the concurrent increase in dopamine particularly in the prefrontal cortex
side_effects: difficulty in reaching orgasm increased amount of ejaculate rare mild headache
comments: my uptake level were not severely out of balance i started with 150 mg and felt the positive effect in 20 minute i wa told it would take a week i reduced the dosage to 75 mg then 37 5 mg after six month because i felt those dos to be too strong i know others that found this drug helpful others it had no effect on at all even at dos of 300 mg

benefits: i have been able to maintain sobriety and get my life back on track methadone ha allowed me to get my bearing underneath me and really focus on what is important in life once again after about 6 month i began working and have been promoted consistently since then i am currently tapering and am really trying to be smart about it while i am very eager to be off methadone i also do not want to rush it i feel that methadone should be one of the last option a person look to when trying to stop opiate use because it is not something that can be stopped whenever a person feel ready i have found it to be quite a complex task
side_effects: weight gain weight gain weight gain i do not know if it is just because of the methadone slowing your metabolism or if it is caused by the need to eat sweet but i have gained at least 90 lb since starting methadone 7 year ago it is likely a combition of both i have also seen a sever decline with my teeth and the only because i can think of is methadone i have taken such good care of my teeth a far a self care and making sure i see the dentist every 6 month and that still ha not helped ha anyone else noticed this i have started having sever pain in my joint a well especially my knee i can honestly say though that without this medication i probably would not be alive to experience any of these minor side effect without a doubt methadone along with the therapy i received while in the clinic and my family support ha saved my life i will take the weight gain and minor discomfort any day at least i am here to write about it
comments: i had tried many time to get sober before beginning mmt i started methadone after 3 unsuccessful try at in patient and outpatient therapy when i first began treatment i traveled 2 hour a day to received the dosage after about a year i wa lucky enough to get in to a clinic closer to my home but by that time i had completed all of the necessary counseling hour and had also received all clean swab and urine test and wa given 3 day take home eventually that wa extended to 6 day which is the most in my state or clinic that you are allowed it ha been about 7 year now and i am in a total good place in life and feel that it is time to start tapering i have held the same job for almost 5 year have a car have my finces somewhat in order and am ready to move on to the next phase while i have had a relatively easy time of tapering i had to stop for a couple of week because i started feeling some slight stomach cramping and body ache i made the decision to go down 2 mg a week in hope that such a small amount per week would allow my body to easily adjust to the change so far so good and i am hoping that by next summer i will be completely done

dosage: 130 mg  taken daily for the period of 7 yrs

comments: initially took 10mg twice a day after 6 month reduced to once a day after one year reduced to 1 every other day or so when blood test consistently resulted in normal thyroid level stopped taking methimazole altogether i have been in remission now for 1 yr

dosage: varies 10-30 mgs   taken 2-3 x per day for the period of 6 years

benefits: stabilizes my thyroid function and brings it into a normal range consequently my heart rate normalizes
side_effects: early in treatment drs would give me a specific dose to take for a long a 6 week during this amount of time on say 30 20 mg per day my thyroid would become so enlarged i could barely swallow i now have a better handle on it and monitor my self with either breaking pill or smaller dos which i can control also i now have osteopenia
comments: first need to say drs waned me to have thyroid ablation i opted to keep my thyroid and treat with mediycation rather than killing it off chemically and becoming hypo thyroid and treating with a replacement synthroid type med early in treatment drs would give me a certain dose to take for a much a 6 week long after reaching normal tsh etc thyroid level now i monitor myself by how i feel and usually i am not accurate but most of the time i am also i now have osteopenia exercise and calcium and vit d are all very important

dosage: 10mg  taken 1 x daily ( same time ) for the period of 1 week +
benefits: am having very crisp vision ability increased moment of clarity thought seems much better heart and leg irritation nerve calmed back to normal what i remember normal a still have moment where hyperthyroidism hit but this is early in treatment however this drug took me from a very poor life oversleeping shaky blurred vision trembling hand heart jumping out of chest life and ha made me feel very very normal
side_effects: the side effect are not seen if any because if the exist they are better than this incredible terrifying experience of hyperthyroid episode that were haunting and devistated my life in many area am drinking fluid one of my side effect of the hyperthyroid wa not being able to eat or hold down food but very hungry all the time i am on liquid and increase to solid slowly now
comments: i saw my primary doc and er doctor all to be diagnosed a panic attack i lived on and off of valum and other anti depressant and nothing would ever control only blanket my tremor and shaky clouded mind one er doctor decided to run the thyroid test that came back positive for hyperthyroidism i saw a specialist who then immediately put me on methimazole 10mg 1 time a day untile iodine test can be done delerious a i wa over a week ago i held couch in lost world of confusion tonight my ear stopped popping ringing is gone heart beating nice for this night i believe that the methimazole is starting to work i am not tired and feel like going outside unbelievable if this is the beginning to my life back this drug ha the key to sanity for the upcoming choice for long term treatment and care i must make soon note due to contrast given in cat scan i must wait 6 week to undergo the iodine testing i understood that the contrast would throw off test result i assume or am prepared for a relapse because this is a very short time into treatment but if this is a glimps of what clarity is ahead a wonderful drug to be treated with

comments: i wa in an mva in 2002 in which i suffered a whiplash type injury which caused accelerated the ddd i wa prescribed percocette 5mg on an a needed basis for pain control after 3 year of constant agonizing pain of being on the percocette they became ineffective at relieving pain and i wa referred to a pain clinic specializing in chronic pain the doctor there decided that i had built up a tolerance dependence on the percocette and that it would be best to put me on a longer acting rcotic oxycontin 10mg time released supposed to provide pain relief for 12 hr with percocette oxycodone 5mg acetaminophen 325 mg for break through pain in the beginning the medication seemed to help but over time i built up a tolerance to the oxycodone they became le effective which meant i had to keep increasing the dosage to get the same amount of pain relief for example i started out with oxycontin 10mg 3x day and approx 3 percocette daily a couple of month later a my tolerance increased i had to take oxycontin 20mg 3x day and 5 6 percocette a the month passed by my tolerance grew and my dosage wa increased after about 8 month on the oxycontin i started to experience all of the side effect mentioned above not only did i notice the negative effect the drug wa having on me but friend and family noticed too and mentioned not to me but amongst themselves that my appearance demeanor over the past 2 yr had dramatically changed a couple of month ago my sister took me aside and asked me what wa wrong to which i replied nothing why she then explained to me how my behavior depression moodiness etc and appearance drastic weight loss had been getting worse and worse and told me that she wa worried being under the influence of these drug for so long i felt like i wa in a fog and really had no idea a to the extent of how bad it really wa how i looked so i stepped back and examined the last 4 5 yr of my life while on these medication and realized that they had taken a considerable toll on me emotiolly physically mentally i strongly advise that before anyone decides to go this route for pain magement that you have a long talk with your physician on the pro and con of this medication specifically the oxycontin if i would have known then what i know now about all the negative side effect i would never never had started taking it i feel that it deteriorated my body especially my muscle mass and skin when i started taking the medication i wa 37 and felt 25 and wa told i looked like i wa in my late 20 s i am now 42 i feel 50 and now in an effort to spare my feeling people do not mention anything about how old i look i wish that my physician would have told me about all of the negative effect of this medication instead of just the positive which are few in my opinion the negative far outweigh the positive i am still in constant pain but will continue to search for pain magement without drug please use with caution

benefits: ostensibly this will halt or even reverse the effect of male pattern baldness so far one month in there is not a great deal to report i expected my hair loss to temporarily increase a i had read in the literature that a dormant hair follicle reactivate they push dead hair out in order to form new one in other word hair in a dead follicle will linger for a few month and reactivation of the follicle will push out the old hair to make room for the new so far this ha not occurred the product must be taken for up to two year for any noticeable hair growth to take place so i really have not been on it long enough to judge it re growth potential in term of halting the process however i must say there are fewer hair in my brush each morning so it is possible the drug is having an effect already i will post a fuller report in another forty seven month i suppose
side_effects: i wa surprised to experience brief blinding headache in the upper left rear quadrant of my head like a mini second long burst of pressure that felt like a blunt object suddenly trying to explode out of my skull this pressure would subside and i would go about my day i am told headache are not one of the usual side effect so it may be an unrelated fluke however i have never had such an experience before and it only manifested within about forty eight hour of my first taking the drug and for seventy two hour thereafter the sudden and sporadic burst of acute pain subsided however but i would caution anyone taking this drug for the first time to be on the lookout especially if driving or in a public place with bright light and a lot of noise around
comments: overall whether i am having some sort of placebo effect reaction or not my subjective impression is that hair loss ha slowed or stopped and that the hair remaining appears fuller i presented my symptom to the doctor and she issued a prescription that same day which i filled that afternoon at a local pharmacy and began taking immediately the formulation i wa prescribed wa 1 milligram although i believe the usual prescription is for 2 milligram and can go a high a 5 milligram my case wa mild to begin with so it may be difficult to judge result however other than the mild side effect i described above which subsided within three day i must say overall that my experience ha been a positive one

side_effects: no change in sex drive far le ejaculate than before however age 55 might have something to do with that
comments: 1 mg per day and that wa it

1 out of every 50 test subject while it happened to 0 out of every 50 who took the placebo what is vasodilatation vasodilatation nearly always referred to a the more recognizable vasodilation refers to the general relaxation of blood vessel a phenomenon that usually end up causing a small drop in blood pressure but sometimes cause a significant blood pressure drop when it is then called hypotension and if you will read on you will see why for me and potentially for 1 out of every 50 user of provigil it very nearly killed me after 7 week on provigil with the last week having been increased from 200mg to 300mg per day i awoke one morning in a highly delusiol state speaking of non existent farm animal wandering around the kitchen table where my wife and i were seated after apparently collapsing in my bedroom i wa taken to er which quickly determined that i wa critically hypotensive low blood pressure of 72 35 i quickly lapsed into cardiogenic shock a condition where the heart all but stop pumping blood and one of the deadliest of all medical crisis even among those who are still alive upon arrival at an er 70 to 80 die within hour or a few day those who survive likely do so a i did with kidney in acute failure and brain damage similar to what is sustained by near drowning victim who have been resuscitated by a lengthy cpr session

comments: the patient wa referred to the psychiatrist by his cardiologist secondary to depression and increasing insomnia the patient had been on welbutrin for year for depression and smoking cessation the psychiatrist kept the patient on welbutrin and added xax for anxiety and seroquel for sleep at bedtime slowly the family started noticing strange behavior delusion and almost dementia type characteristic in the patient that occured over a 4 month period and began to get more severe the family attempted to talk about the change with the patient but a true delusiol behavior dictate the patient wa uble to see any of the change the forgetfulness clumsiness and persolity change such a irritability increased the family attempted to contact the psychiatrist but in interim the patient died of a cardiac arrest even after talking to the psychiatrist after the patient s death the psychiatrist denied that seroquel had any affect on the situation the family and myself a the primary caretaker believe that seroquel wa directly responsible for the patient s death we do not plan to seek legal retribution but hope that anyone that read this will be more cautious about prescribing seroquel in someone that already ha cardiac problem and to please be careful about it is possible interaction with other medication

benefits: i wa diagnosed with bipolar ii disorder in february of 2009 i found that my manic state led to very erratic and inconsistent behavior i also found the depressive low to be particularly difficult to mage in november 2009 i wa prescribed seroquel by a urgent care physician immediately i found it calming effect to be extremely relieving to my mania i did however find it difficult to maintain a functioning state due to it sedating effect i then switched to seroquel xr and found a much more successful experience i wa initially given 400mg seroquel xr paired with 10mg lexapro while initially a good way to stop the mania i found 400mg to be too much to function on i decided to halve my seroquel xr dose to 200mg continuing to take 10mg of lexapro this combo ha been great and i am so much calmer and feel way more in control of my life i do however find the sedating effect to be difficult upon awaking in the morning i try to offset this by ensuring that i receive a full 8 10 hour rest after administering a dosage i would highly recommend this combo to anyone that is having difficulty finding a mental balance between dark and light this year of treatment ha allowed me to find a calm that i have never quite experienced beforehand
side_effects: i found that despite the great benefit mentally the physical side effect are a fair trade i wa about 115 lb when i started this drug 10 month ago today i way about 147lbs that is definitely a 37 pound gain additiolly i always prided myself on my enormous amount of energy after taking this drug i am extremely lethargic in the hour after taking it bedtime and the morning hour
comments: i take 200mg of seroquel xr and 10mg of lexapro nightly

comments: after i turned 38 my skin changed it became much oilier and i started having large acne lesion again around my chin this wa especially true before a period or when i wa under stress at work i decided to see a dermatologist a i wa sick of the acne i started yaz which wa alright a well a retin a this did not seem to address the larger lesion so my dr prescribed solodyn looking back now i think the side effect started in the first couple week i just did not identify them a related to the drug i thought i wa suffering from carpal tunnel at work and could explain why my knee hurt so much i wa just about to go to an orthopod when i decided to investigate the solodyn more i read about the joint pain and lupus like symptom stopped the drug immediately and called my dr to get in and see her she did some bloodwork and i had a positive a blood result mid positive not low this is one indicator of lupus my dermatologist wa adamant that the symptom would go away now i called the office again a week later a i wa still having strong side effect and wa pretty worried i got a phone call back that basically said hello hypochondriac you do not have lupus then my eye pain started and my eye turned totally red i went to my gp who referred me to an opthalmologist who diagnosed iritis and i started 7 week of drop she also referred me to a rheumatologist who ran a number of test and told me she is seen minocycline drug do this to people a lot and she would never take one or have her child take one great that is my saga now dealing with another iritis flair up and a lot of pain in my left knee 4 month after stopping the drug please do not take this drug

benefits: this is probably the best skin care product medicine available it is highly effective for both acne and photo aging it exfoliates the skin better than anything else thus unclogging the pore it also speed up cell turnover which reduces keratinization preventing comedo formation it smooth out wrinkle make the deep layer of skin dermis thicker increase collagen production etc you can read about all it benefit on pubmed it ha been proven more effective than tretinoin retin a for both acne and photoaging
side_effects: initially it is quite irritating that is why it is very important to start using it le often and with a smaller applied amount do not overdose on tazorac or else your skin the upper horny layer statum corneum will become so thin and dry that it will crack thus you will actually create wrinkle rather than elimite any if you take it slowly and gradually increase the dose you will not have that problem a the skin adjusts to it you should probably start using it only every 3rd or 4th day initially gradually increasing to every other day or even every day some people are able to use it twice a day i know i cannot in case you develop severe irritation you must use a good moisturizer to prevent wrinkle formation if you are using it for acne and are using other product such a benzoyl peroxide a you should you should be even more careful a skin irritation is cumulative from the various drug you will have to use a lower dose bp such a 2 5 because your skin will be exfoliated and more easily irritated

dosage: 120 mg  taken 3 times daily, 1 at each meal for the period of 3 months
benefits: cholesterol went from 265 to 199 lost 32 lb in 3 month
side_effects: one incident of an oily stool
comments: i took part in a 3 month obesity binge eating study back in 2004 which included the use of a placebo or orlistat xenical conducted by a local hospital medical center i would meet with the doctor s weekly and wa put on a low fat diet and asked to do moderate exercise of 30 40 minute 3 day a week during this study at the time i wa age 39 5 ft 7 and 200 lb and a cholesterol level of 265 you had to have a bmi of 30 percent in order to participate in study and i just made it per the weight and height chart half of the study participant were put on a placebo pill and half were put on orlistat xenical they did not tell the participant during the study if they had the placebo or if they had the orlistat at the end of the 3 month study i lost 32 lb down to 168 lb and my cholesterol went from 265 to 199 i wa told at that time i wa taking orlistat the participant who took orlistat lost more weight than the one who took placebo and did the low fat diet i can only remember once having what may have been an oily stool i never had cramp diarrhea or any type of bowel accident it is now 2010 and i have put on 20 lb since i am considering trying to get my family doctor to prescribe orlistat i have not heard anything negative about the medication except for the side effect of oily stool etc i believe the people who have experienced the bad side effect are people who are continuing to eat fatty food such a pizza cheeseburger etc and continue to take the orlistat if you follow the direction you are to eat low fat and also take a multi vitamin i look forward to trying out the orlistat again
